result.execSummary:
The defendant Kim Ronnie Blatcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Inclusive of costs.
Refund balance of bond to payor.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot, ADA: Edward Minser. DF ATTY:  Shirlene Renee Perrin   DF:  Kim Ronnie Blatcher appeared. Includes Plea on 14CF511 and PAYH on 14TR5122. Case called at 11:24 am. There is an agreement. ADA Minser moves to amend Count one to Criminal Misdemeanor 961.41(3g)(e). Atty Perrin makes statement. Court amends count one. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for amended count one, Def pleads No Contest. Defendant waives right to receive discovery. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of count one. 14TR5122 is reopened and dismissed. Parties make sentencing arguements. Court orders: F/F $250.00 including costs. Apply Bond. km
